content.prompt_es: Fill in the blanks with the correct verb forms to complete the sentences using mixed conditionals.
content.main_text: If I (1)___ the presentation better, I would have succeeded in the meeting.
content.explanation:
(1) En esta oración, el resultado 'would have succeeded' se refiere a una acción que no ocurrió en el pasado.
(2) Aquí se usa el pasado perfecto para expresar una acción que no se realizó en el pasado y su impacto en el presente.
(3) Esta oración muestra cómo una acción pasada afecta a un resultado pasado.
(4) Usamos 'had had' para referirnos a una falta de tiempo en el pasado que afecta el presente.
(5) Esta oración muestra que la falta de acción en el pasado afecta la situación actual.

content.prompt_es: What is one main argument of proponents of strict regulations?
content.explanation: Los defensores de regulaciones estrictas creen que la falta de acción tendrá consecuencias negativas para las generaciones futuras.
content.stimulus_en: In recent years, the debate surrounding climate change has intensified, leading to various viewpoints on how societies should respond. Proponents of strict regulations argue that without immediate action, future generations will suffer the consequences of inaction. They cite scientific evidence indicating that rising temperatures will result in more extreme weather patterns, affecting agriculture, water supply, and health. On the other hand, critics of these regulations point out the economic implications, suggesting that such measures could stifle growth and lead to job losses in key industries. They advocate for a more balanced approach, emphasizing adaptation over restriction, which could allow for economic stability while still addressing environmental concerns. Ultimately, the challenge lies in finding a solution that reconciles environmental sustainability with economic vitality, ensuring a livable planet for future generations.
